Key Match Events: Bafana Bafana let slip a 1-0 lead as they drew 1-1 with Congo-Brazzaville in the pair's second Africa Cup of Nations (Afcon) qualifier
The Congolese were rewarded for their resilience and persistence when they equalised through Mons Bassouamina on the stroke of halftime
Pre-Game Insights: Coach Hugo Broos trusted Khuliso Mudau and Teboho Mokoena despite their limited game time at club level, and they justified his decision to stick with them
Post-Match Reflections: Bafana Bafana need one win from their final two matches of the qualifying campaign to secure passage to the next continental showpiece
The central Africans kept alive their slim hopes of qualifying for Afcon 2025 in Morocco
Miscellaneous Highlights: The display by the Congolese was particularly impressive after their shambolic showing in South Africa a few days ago
Bafana Bafana struggle on artificial pitches
Others: Bafana Bafana will play group leaders Uganda on 11 November, before hosting South Sudan a few days later
